title: Trump brings in new 10% tariff as Supreme Court rejects his global import taxes
partialText: The Supreme Court decision striking down some of Trump's most sweeping tariffs injects new uncertainty into global trade.

title: Government considers removing Andrew from royal line of succession
partialText: The former Duke of York is eighth in line to the throne meaning he remains eligible to be King.

title: Palestinian Authority in dire straits as Israel's hold on West Bank deepens
partialText: More than 30 years after its creation, there are increasing warnings that the PA is close to collapse.

title: UK should send non-combat troops to Ukraine now, former PM Johnson tells BBC
partialText: Troops should be deployed to peaceful parts of the country in non-fighting roles, he said.

title: 'It's ruined my life': Hundreds tell BBC how medication triggered gambling and other addictions
partialText: More than 250 people contacted us describing impulsive behaviour side effects from prescription drugs.

title: Watch: Baby monkey Punch cuddles soft toy after being abandoned by mother
partialText: A young Japanese macaque at the Ichikawa City Zoo in Japan went viral, after videos showed him playing with a soft toy that zookeepers gave him for comfort.

title: Team GB face uphill task for four-man bobsleigh medal
partialText: Team GB face an uphill task to win an Olympic medal in the four-man bobsleigh event as they sit seventh at the halfway point in Cortina.

title: Six races, six golds - Klaebo's historic Olympics
partialText: Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo, Norway's king of cross-country skiing, breaks the record for the most gold medals won at a single Winter Olympics with his sixth of the Games.

title: GB go for men's curling gold and Atkin in halfpipe final - Saturday's guide
partialText: What's happening and who to look out for at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina.

title: Bond, bagpipes & controversial Canadians - why curling is must-watch
partialText: Curling might seem a strange choice for prime-time Saturday night viewing, but at 18:05 GMT - live on the BBC - millions will find themselves tuning in to see if Team GB can add a fourth gold medal of these Winter Olympics.

title: Why fake AI videos of UK urban decline are taking over social media
partialText: Deepfakes showing grim taxpayer-funded waterparks have gone viral and drawn some racist responses.

title: Civilians to soldiers: how four years of war has changed ordinary Ukrainians
partialText: Seven Ukrainian men and women in uniform reveal how Russia's invasion in 2022 has changed them.

title: The best looks at London Fashion Week 2026
partialText: There are 90 designers showing this year, with organisers hoping it's the biggest fashion week yet.

title: Killing of nationalist student leaves French far left in deep trouble as elections loom
partialText: Far-left militants are suspected of being behind Quentin Deranque's death and the party of Jean-Luc Mélenchon is being widely condemned.

title: I might not get uni Covid compensation - but I'm claiming it out of principle
partialText: Dozens of universities have received legal letters over what students say they missed out on during Covid.

title: Two men aged 19 and 20 die after going missing on Yr Wyddfa
partialText: Mountain rescue teams were launched in challenging conditions to try and find the pair.

title: How Co-op Live went from falling air con units to hosting the Brits
partialText: The opening of the Co-op Live was in every headline, but not quite for the right reasons.

title: What parents, students and teachers want to see changed in the government's SEND reform
partialText: Some government plans for SEND were leaked earlier this week. But what else do families want to change?

title: Katseye's Manon to take 'temporary hiatus' to focus on health
partialText: The six-person girl group say the decision was made following "open and thoughtful conversations together".

title: Tumbler Ridge suspect's ChatGPT account banned before shooting
partialText: OpenAI said the account's activity did not meet the threshold to flag it to authorities when it was identified.

title: Third man arrested after teens die at holiday park
partialText: Ethan Slater, 17, and Cherish Bean, 15, died at a holiday park near Bridlington on Wednesday.

title: Welcome to Australia's hottest beach event - nowhere near the sea
partialText: Tonnes of sand and flocks of tourists are ferried into Cootamundra for its annual volleyball tournament.

title: Italian toddler dies after transplant with heart 'burned by frostbite'
partialText: The heart given to two-year-old Domenico was reportedly severely damaged during its transfer to hospital.

title: Is £70 becoming harder to justify? The rise of cheaper blockbuster games
partialText: As top games such as GTA 6 are speculated to cost $100 (£74), some developers are deliberately pricing lower.

title: Teen dies after being stabbed outside mosque
partialText: A murder investigation is under way into the death of Zeshan Afzal, 18.

title: Multi-cancer blood test missed key goal in NHS trial
partialText: The company behind the test said there were positive signs that some of the most aggressive cancers could be prevented.

title: UK snow carver comes second in global contest with Olympic sculpture
partialText: Pippa Unwin says she is delighted to succeed with her "ridiculously complicated" design.

title: Striking drone footage shows ship abandoned off coast of Wales
partialText: Jay Curtis was flying his drone when he spotted the Resolute vessel off the coast of Pembrokeshire.

title: Supermarket worker's kindness meant I could feed my newborn baby
partialText: Emma and Harry Brown say the Asda employee's kindness helped them to feed and clothe their new baby.

title: Penguins delight residents in care home visit
partialText: Residents were able to hold and stroke the two Humboldt penguins during the visit.

partialText: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: A star-filled, jaw-dropping black comedy
